result.execSummary:
The defendant Alan D. Pichotta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Alan D. Pichotta is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Alan D. Pichotta was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Infliction of Physical Pain or Injury], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Alan D. Pichotta was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit for 5 days only if revoked.
Concurrent with: Jail time on 16CF57.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant may not have any contact with the victim (D.P.)

The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns.

The defendant must enroll and participate in an anger management program and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must submit a DNA sample.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:34 PM. Cirilli - here for PLEAS on both matters - provides court with plea questionnaire. State - have complied with victim notification requirements and she is in the courtroom today  - plead to counts #1 and #2 on 15CM149 and plead to amended count #2 of misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) on 16CF57  - 120 days in FC jail, court costs, dismiss count #1; dismiss counts #3 and #4 on 15CF149; for counts #1 and #2 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 12 months probation with conditions of: $500 fine plus costs on count #1 as domestic, #2 - court costs only, AODA and follow thru, anger management with follow thru, restitution as submitted today by State (Amended) - $7358.21  plus VW surcharge of $735.82 for a total restitution amount of $8094.03, maintain absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments, 100 hours of community service, no contact with victim. Cirilli and Pichotta agree - 5 days of jail credit on 15CF149 and 2 days of jail credit on 16CF57 and has $1500.00 posted total between the two cases. Court - 15CF149 - court dismisses counts #3 and #4. Pichotta pleads G to count #1 as alleged and NC to count #2 as alleged. Court - 165CF57 - court amends count #2 of misd bail jumping contrary to 946.49(1)(a) - reads new charge and penalty, court dismisses count #1. Pichotta pleads NC to count #2 as amended. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Cirilli makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Pichotta makes statement, remorseful. Victim makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CF57 - count #2 - 120 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - report today - eligible for community service under 93.03(3) - 2 days credit (stipulated) - report today, costs - take bond posted and remainder put on 15CF149; on 15CF149 - counts #1 and #2, withhold sentence and place on probation for 1 year  - concurrent to jail time on 16CF57 - with conditions of: AODA and follow thru, anger management with follow thru, $500.00 plus costs on count #1 - paid thru probation, costs only on count #2 - paid thru probation, no consumption or possession of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 100 hours of community service, no contact with victim (DP), restitution the amount of $8094.03 (stipulated amount) - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation, submit DNA sample with expunction rights given, credit for 5 days only if revoked, right to appeal, adjourned.
Substitute - CS - Subpeona and Certificate of Appearance

Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:47 PM. State - believes there is no agreement. Cirilli and Pichotta agree. State recites offer on record. Pichotta does not agree with the offer and understands the offer will be rejected.  Bond to be continued.  Jury trial scheduled for February 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's response to state's demand for discovery

ADDRESS INFO for Alan D. Pichotta
Current: 1647 Rangeline Road, Wabeno, WI 54566 United States  (Effective: 10-01-2015)
Prior: 4841 Highway 52, Wabeno, WI 54566

Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:23 PM. State - In anticipation of filing a waiver of PH, has filed INFO which mirrors. Cirilli has filed waiver of PH to court. Court goes over waiver form and finds the defendant is freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to a PH. Court finds probable cause & binds over for trial. Proceed to ARGN. Cirilli waives further reading of INFO and enters pleas of NG to all counts. Cirilli indicates due to his defenant's business being at his residence, asking for permission to enter storage shed. Court indicates that bond condition on this case is to have no direct contact, does not feel being on the property is in violation. State makes argument and suggests all items be removed from marital property. Court instructs if there is a restraining order in place the court cannot change that at this time and defendant must abide by that order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in court.   Charles Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:07 AM. Pichotta has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Pichotta understands charges and penalties Defendant Alan D. Pichotta in court with attorney Gary S. Cirilli.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cirilli now arrives to represent the defendant, waives further reading of the complaint, set for PH and waives time limits. Court continues bond but the defendant needs to sign it. State would like a no possession of firearms condition added. Court orders.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
